title: Moz News - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Rand Fishkin January 22, 2008 Advice for Startup CEOs Moz News In honor of today's holiday, I thought I'd change up the subject and talk a little bit about leadership in a small business startup. This is a subject that I don't have nearly the authority or experience to speak about in the same way as SEO. After all, I've worked on dozens of successful search marketing projects, but only one startup - ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin January 21, 2008 Rewriting the Beginner's Guide Part IV Continued - Canonical and Duplicate Versions of Content Moz News I'm currently working on re-authoring and re-building the Beginner's Guide to Search Engine Optimization, section by section. You can read more about this project here. Why Canonical Versions of Content are Critical to SEO ... Read this post A By: agco January 18, 2008 Updating Site = Lost Rankings? Moz News Can anyone help me sift through some conflicting advice?I've been tasked with launching an updated site for a medical clinic that, through the work of a local SEO consultant, has a couple of #1 and #2 rankings for critical search terms in Google (with lesser rankings on Yahoo). The site we'd hoped to replace is antiquated visually and is difficult to navigate. ... Read this post C By: CredoPaul January 15, 2008 Upping the Ante: Win a One Year Premium SEOmoz Membership - $399 Value! Moz News Written and submitted by Seanmag. I’ve asked Rebecca to post this under “CredoPaul," on behalf of the ... Read this post B By: Brent Payne January 13, 2008 Kids, Plug Your Ears! I Am Going to Talk About SEO P_rn! Moz News Okay . . . so I did a round of interviews this week with fairly decent success (though, if I am still unemployed in a month then I guess it wasn’t successful after all, lol). Who did I meet with? Sorry, not divulging that info because frankly most readers of this blog are outstanding SEOs and could turn into my competition for the positions. Note: For the handful that do kn... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin January 7, 2008 A Special Thanks from SEOmoz Moz News Without doubt, 2007 was our best year ever, and it's all your fault! Thanks so much to all our members, readers and contributors, and everyone in the Internet Marketing field. Without you, we'd be a sad, surly bunch.... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin January 3, 2008 SEOmoz's Stats for 2007 Moz News Following in Danny's footsteps over at SELand, I'm offering up SEOmoz's website stats for 2007. Enjoy! Visits January - 202,622 February - 309,924 March - 283,417 April - 280,284 ... Read this post L By: Lori Bourne January 2, 2008 The Readiness Is All (Or, How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Embrace 2008) Moz News When I was a senior in high school, I was in AP English. My teacher, Mr. Hunt, was a kind but eccentric guy. He loved Shakespeare and made sure we spent plenty of time studying the Bard. In the spring, we studied Hamlet. After reading the play and discussing it in class, we were given the assignment of writing a paper about it. Mr. Hunt saw Hamlet as a one giant meta... Read this post A By: AdamDorfman January 1, 2008 Apparently the Government Hates SEOs Too Moz News I just came across this line item in the 2008 federal budget. How many of ya'll plan on closing up shop now? ... Read this post By: Rishi Lakhani December 31, 2007 My Job and Passion are Making Me Into an Insomniac Moz News So I like reading the newspaper as well as a couple of hundred blogs and old collector editions of Assimov's and Analog's. In most cases I tend to stick to the Daily Telegraph, where I came across this little gem. In a nutshell... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin December 31, 2007 Rewriting the Beginner's Guide - Part IV Continued: Titles, Meta Data, & URL Structures Moz News For the next few weeks, I'm working on re-authoring and re-building the Beginner's Guide to Search Engine Optimization, section by section. You can read more about this project here.... Read this post By: Richard Baxter December 26, 2007 Changing User Agents with Firefox Moz News In the last Whiteboard Friday (12/20/07) Rand talked with Stephan Spencer on the subject of conditional 301 redirects using user agent detection. I thought it might be useful to briefly cover how easy it is to set up Firefox to use a non-default user agent (like Yahoo, Google etc) for testing and development... Read this post By: rmccarley December 26, 2007 Being an SEOmoz Premium Member Hurts Your Moz Score and Correlation does Not Equal Causation Moz News First, let me say I hope this post will be taken in the spirit in which it is intended – to have a little fun with our Moz community and to learn something applicable to almost everything in life – even SEO! While looking at the SEOmoz Top Ranked Members the other day I noticed that I’m listed at #19 which is fantastic, especially since ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin December 20, 2007 Technology Sites Receive an Overwhelming Majority of Search Traffic from Google Moz News A great many tech-specific site owners consistently bemoan the fact that market share stats like these: Percentage of U.S. Searches Among Leading Search Engine Providers...
